snippet: As Israel began to redeploy significant numbers of troops away from populated areas of Gaza on Sunday, an Israeli Air Force missile struck near the school entrance.
abstract: Israel begins to redeploy significant numbers of troops away from populated areas of Gaza, but an Israeli Air Force missile strikes near entrance of United Nations school sheltering displaced Palestinians in Rafah, killing 10 people and wounding 35; strike draws new round of international condemnation, and United States calls attack 'disgraceful'; Israel says jihadists were target.

byline.original: By STEVEN ERLANGER and FARES AKRAM
byline.contributor: Steven Erlanger reported from Jerusalem, and Fares Akram from Gaza. Jodi Rudoren and Rina Castelnuovo contributed reporting from Kfar Saba, Israel.

lead_paragraph: As Israel began to redeploy significant numbers of troops away from populated areas of Gaza on Sunday, an Israeli Air Force missile struck near the school entrance.

headline.main: Airstrike Near U.N. School Kills 10 as Israel Shifts Troops in Gaza
headline.print_headline: Missile Strike Near U.N. School in Gaza Kills 10
